## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-rewriterope-cpp-/ropepiecebtreenode">RopePieceBTreeNode</a> - Common base class of <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-rewriterope-cpp-/ropepiecebtreeleaf">RopePieceBTreeLeaf</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-rewriterope-cpp-/ropepiecebtreeinterior">RopePieceBTreeInterior</a>.

This provides some &#39;virtual&#39; dispatching methods and a flag that determines which subclass the instance is. Also important, this node knows the full extend of the node, including any children that it has. This allows efficient skipping over entire subtrees when looking for an offset in the BTree.

Definition at line 76 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp">RewriteRope.cpp</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### anonymous enum  {#a4ba733354167c4801fb98506f22a6c3c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="anonymous enum "
 labels = {["protected"]}>
WidthFactor - This controls the number of K/V slots held in the BTree: how wide it is.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a4ba733354167c4801fb98506f22a6c3ca4a2ee1f78a24b36d2981e78ec567d4f0" />
<EnumerationListItem name="WidthFactor">
 (= 8)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

Each level of the BTree is guaranteed to have at least &#39;WidthFactor&#39; elements in it (either ropepieces or children), (except the root, which may have less) and may have at most 2&#42;WidthFactor elements.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp/#l00083">83</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp">RewriteRope.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### erase() {#a0ebe00475d51e2c28cf5dcd1e260afa5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void RopePieceBTreeNode::erase (unsigned Offset, unsigned NumBytes)">
erase - Remove NumBytes from this node at the specified offset.

We are guaranteed that there is a split at Offset.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp/#l00120">120</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp">RewriteRope.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### insert() {#a5a8475c86206d8ba61d5ecd244871a2c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>RopePieceBTreeNode &#42; RopePieceBTreeNode::insert (unsigned Offset, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ropepiece">RopePiece</a> &amp; R)</>}>
insert - Insert the specified ropepiece into this tree node at the specified offset.

The offset is relative, so &quot;0&quot; is the start of the node.

If there is no space in this subtree for the extra piece, the extra tree node is returned and must be inserted into a parent.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp/#l00116">116</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp">RewriteRope.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### split() {#a02b6f427df62fc4de4b851a72ce6da66}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>RopePieceBTreeNode &#42; RopePieceBTreeNode::split (unsigned Offset)</>}>
split - Split the range containing the specified offset so that we are guaranteed that there is a place to do an insertion at the specified offset.

The offset is relative, so &quot;0&quot; is the start of the node.

If there is no space in this subtree for the extra piece, the extra tree node is returned and must be inserted into a parent.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp/#l00108">108</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp">RewriteRope.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
